author: wvalthar
title: @chain-lib WordPress Plugin
description: 任何人都应该很容易创建一个兼容Cardano web3的网站，无论他们的技术专长如何。

f6_assessments.q0: Currently there are limited tools or library in the Cardano ecosystem to build dApps, and this one propose a solution port existing @chain-lib library into WordPress plugin. This proposal align with the solution of the challenge, that is to attract more developer to build on Cardano. Looking the documentation on GitHub proves that it will able to scale in the future since it is an open source and everyone can contribute. That being said, it would be better if this proposal could articulates the benefit of how porting @chain-lib library into WordPress plugin would would be -not only beneficial, but also- necessary. For example: explaining the demand of how many WordPress developer are looking for crypto payment gateway –especially with Cardano–, hence by creating this plugin it will increase more adoption and integration for Cardano ecosystem. That way, we could see and understand the demand behind this, and not just as a "nice to have" WordPress plugin.
f6_assessments.q1: Relevant experience is proved by giving GitHub repo that already have their work in it, being an SPO, Alonzo Purple tester, and Plutus Pioneer 1. However, it's hard to verify those things, since the proposer doesn't disclose their full name and we couldn't find any track record other than their Github repo. It would be better if this proposer include their Linkedin account. The proposer will be working on this alone, so it will be a one person project. Seeing the timetable span across 6 months, it seems too long seeing that the proposer will only work for 37 + 80 = 117 hours in total. Regarding the budget, I understand that this is a one person project, but it would be better if the proposer also explain how those tax is calculated, so we could verify if the budget is honest and true. From the implementation details (technical aspects), it only shows what's going to be done without actually showing how to do it. It would be helpful if the proposer at least provides the monthly implementation target, so then we would know what are the steps for implementing it.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal doesn't have a clear roadmap other than "Within 6 months, everything will be done". Providing roadmap and detailed key metrics / KPIs will help the audit to be more clear and transparent. Although the description of targeted problem is provided, the solution didn't explained thoroughly on how it will viable to be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem that the team proposes is within this challenge. Info in the proposal can't help to assess anything and can't prove that their project will add more value to the Cardano ecosystem, even they don't have any key metrics. And after 5 proposal with the same content, I think this is just a draft idea. Hope that the team can do better in next fund with at least key metrics, and some info to show that they really concern about that challenge given.
f6_assessments.q1:
Can't score the feasibility of this project. The team provides a GitHub but I don't know what it will be used for. 
Moreover, they don't have a roadmap and KPI to show their detailed step-to-step of developing this project. So, it is hard to assess that their budget is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team lacks of: roadmap and key metrics. For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem, and their solution is just a brief in the overview, that all make sense how they will solve the problem or how hard they study about the problem to make a best solution.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea and it would be great if this tool was available to everyone. The deficiency in their Problem Statement is well explained, which gives us additional hope that the project will be realized. Definitely with such a tool and its implementation the Cardano ecosystem would be enriched and would gain even more on its value. Unfortunately because there are no KPIs, its hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides a link to Github but the question is whether this is enough so we can be sure that the project will be delivered. It would be good to have records of relevant skills and experience via LinkedIn and to know who is behind this project and how many people are working on this project. The budget is clearly presented but it would be better to explain it in more depth how the money will be spent so that we could say that a reasonable amount of money is required. The proposal does not mention additional funding so there is no additional plan and also detailed implementable plan. Having details of actionable tasks and order of execution would give us a clear insight into the implementation of certain segments of the project. The proposal mentions a time period of 12 months, which seems realistic if the parameters required for a valid proposal were met. In the project we can see that money is required but it is not clear who will make the project. Technical aspects are missing and information on possible risks and how to deal with these risks is lacking.
f6_assessments.q2: The time frame is mentioned in the proposal, but it would be much clearer if the dates or parts of the year were mentioned  Q1, Q2, Q3. Roadmap with milestones and KPIs are missing so it is hard for the community to follow the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
It great when to port all current @chain-lib components to wordpress. This will help to scale the impact of blockchain faster because there is a lot of website in the world using wordpress. 
But, the proposer only shows problem, solution that can help to solve, and a few words to over what they want to to that hard to well understand to assessing what he wants. Also, he doesn't provide any key metric or info to prove that this solution will help the Cardano ecosystem. This proposal failed to impact.
f6_assessments.q1: There is only a short over about the solution this proposal wants to show and an introduction about already-made open-source of the team that can't understand how it can help this project. My advice for this team is to have a good proposal and enough materials for assessing the feasibility they must give info about a detailed plan they will do, roadmap that with a clear timeline of activities will get instead of just 2 milestone of 6 months and 12 months, clarify team member info for more trust, the budget that is reasonable with the plan and roadmap, risk-relevant that team will face off. Technically, this idea of the project will have a lot of technical stuff but they don't describe any of them, including smart contract, protocol... even more in the user point of view including UX/UI, user cases...
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provide nothing in this proposal to audit it. 
No plan, no roadmap, no key metrics in this proposal.
There is also no info about the problem explanation and no info to say how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about porting current @chain-lib web components over to WordPress. The problem [people find it hard to create a Cardano web3 compatible website] is described, and explained. The solution is defined, with no clear potential impact. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q1: Team [from Chain-lib] profile is provided and described enough for understanding with suitable skill and experiences for implementation. However, it is hard to verify the ability and experiences of each member. Information on demo/pilot/similar works done by this team should be provided. The budget is clear (with items structure, and explanations of calculation base). However, KPIs and Risk (and mitigation) were not provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: Some information is clearly described in this proposal [team profile (chain-lib), budget detail]. However, there is a lack of information: (1) Each team member's profile and external links for verification [community can not define this]; (2) KPIs, (3) Risk (and mitigation). Besides, there is no information on the demo of this plugin, it would be better if this is provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

Automatically deploy plugins = 50 USD * 80 hours
